title: Nimisha Priya execution: Won’t grant pardon, says family of Yemeni victim
content: Social media posts purportedly by Talal’s brother Abdul Fatah Mahdi indicated the family’s resolute stance on retribution as per Islamic law rather than refusing to accept blood money and pardon Nimisha Priya

title: ED raids in U.P., Mumbai in religious conversion 'racket' case against Chhangur Baba
content: The federal probe agency recently filed a case to probe the activities and financial details of Jalaluddin alias Chhangur Baba, alleged to be a mastermind of an illegal religious conversion racket operating in Uttar Pradesh

title: Some cities in northwest, northern Indo-Gangetic Plain shielded from long-range aerosol pollution
content: Researchers refer to the cities that show relatively lower aerosol levels compared with the surrounding areas as Urban Aerosol Clean Islands

title: Nitish Kumar announces free electricity up to 125 units in poll-bound Bihar
content: He said the government has also decided to install solar power plants on the rooftops or in the nearby public places of domestic consumers in the next three years

title: Amarnath Yatra suspended from Jammu due to bad weather
content: The yatra was suspended from both Pahalgam and Baltal base camps following heavy rains and landslides

title: Kudumbashree’s ‘Jana Galsa’ to give tribal art forms a new lease of life
content: Project will transform tribal art forms into viable enterprises that can generate employment and income for the indigenous people

title: Jagan acting like a destructive force, says TDP MLA Nakka Ananda Babu
content: It was Jagan Mohan Reddy who had governed the State in an authoritarian manner for five years, registered false cases against thousands and empowered the police system to achieve his personal vendetta against the opposition leaders, he alleges

title: Two shootings in 12 hours: Multiple teams deployed to trace absconding suspects
content: The attackers, believed to be four to five in number, have been identified and are currently on the run

title: West Bengal once again, without explanation, delays UG admission to colleges run and aided by it
content: Lakhs of students applying for these colleges staring at uncertainty while private/autonomous institutions are set to begin classes shortly

title: Nitish Kumar asks education department to speed up recruitment of teachers
content: Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) termed the announcement of Chief Minister as a mere election slogan and it will get stuck in the model code of conduct (MCC).

title: 41,193 children rescued, 4960 missing women traced under Operation Muskan: CM Fadnavis
content: The issue of missing women was raised in the assembly after Shiv Sena (UBT) MLC Sunil Shinde asked for the status of the proposal to ‘Track missing women’.

title: Tripura CM claims incumbent BJP-led coalition government provided nearly 20,000 regular jobs
content: Dr Manik Saha advised youths to take advantage of entrepreneurship engagements and not to wait only for government jobs

title: Bihar government set up cell to maintain data bank of Supari killers
content: The Bihar Police also suspended a station house officer (SHO) for dereliction of duty in connection with the murder of Patna based industrialist Gopal Khemka.

title: Naidu releases report of Task Force on Economic Development for Swarna Andhra Pradesh
content: The expert panel has made a host of recommendations to the government on diverse sectors that have the potential to catapult it to the league of progressive States

title: Gujarat launches India’s first tribal genome project to tackle inherited diseases
content: The Tribal Genome Sequencing Project is an initiative by the government to sequence the genomes of 2,000 people belonging to tribal communities across 17 districts in the State

title: A.P. and Telangana resolve key river water issues in New Delhi meeting
content: Both States agree to share data reservoirs and preserve Srisailam project;  KRMB will be headquartered in Amaravati, while GRMB will remain in Hyderabad

title: NHRC issues notice to Delhi and UP government over drowning of two kids in public places
content: Observing that the incidents raise serious issues of violation of human rights of the victims, the commission had issued notice calling for a detailed report on the matter within two weeks.

title: Calcutta High Court dismisses teachers’ petitions against new SSC recruitment rules
content: ‘Untainted’ teachers say they are losing faith in the judicial system to offer them justice and said they are being criminalised for corruption done by government authorities

title: BJP government in Uttarakhand promoting VIP culture: Congress
content: The party questions how the BKTC chairman was allowed to fly to Kedarnath by a chopper despite suspension of service

title: Four arrested for misappropriating CMRF funds worth ₹8.71 lakh using forged cheques
content: The accused are alleged to have forged documents and siphoned off government funds intended for financially distressed applicants

title: Hyderabad’s Bolarum saw highest ozone pollution this summer, says study
content: Between March 1 and May 31, Bolarum recorded 17 days when ground-level ozone levels breached the safe limit — the highest in the city

title: Three held in CBI drive against mule account network across seven States
content: As part of ‘Operation Chakra-V,’ the agency searched multiple locations in Delhi, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Kerala, Punjab, Andhra Pradesh, and Rajasthan.

title: J&K making rapid strides on path of peace and prosperity: L-G Manoj Sinha
content: Delivering a lecture at Gandhi Smriti in the national capital, the Lieutenant-Governor says Jammu and Kashmir’s economy had more than doubled over the past five years

title: Agreement for biogas plant in Kozhikode to be signed soon
content: The Corporation will hand over seven acres for the facility, where 150 tonnes of biowaste will be processed

title: No exemption from selection of minor courses this year, says CU Registrar
content: Students pursuing major (main) courses with minors under the four-year undergraduate programme in affiliated colleges must choose all minors from two groups offered by a discipline other than their major, says a circular issued on July 14

title: Kodenchery panchayat to launch digital biodiversity register
content: A 12-member committee has been formed in all the 21 wards to complete the task and release the digitised version on October 2, says panchayat president

title: 'Assigning blame before ...' : Pilots' body raises red flag over Air India 171 crash report
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has voiced strong concerns regarding the preliminary report on the Air India Flight AI171 crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 240 people. FIP criticized the exclusion of pilot representatives from the investigation and the report's reliance on selectively interpreted cockpit recordings.

title: Indian woman caught shoplifting: US embassy reacts after viral video; issues warning
content: Following the arrest of an Indian tourist in the US for alleged shoplifting, the US Embassy in India issued a stern warning. Visa holders risk revocation and a permanent ban for breaking American laws, including theft and assault. Immigration lawyer Alen Takhsh highlighted the severe consequences, even without a conviction, potentially leading to deportation.

title: 9-year-old girl dies of suspected heart attack; fainted while having lunch at school
content: In a tragic incident, nine-year-old Prachi Kumawat, a Class 4 student in Sikar district, passed away at school due to a suspected heart attack. During lunch break, she collapsed while opening her tiffin box. Despite immediate medical attention and CPR at a local hospital, she was referred to a larger hospital in Sikar, but was declared dead on arrival.

title: Gold smuggling case twist: No bail to Ranya Rao for 1 year
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao faces a year in jail for gold smuggling, following an order from the COFEPOSA Advisory Board, which also denied her bail. Arrested at Bengaluru airport with 14.8 kg of gold worth Rs 12.56 crore smuggled from Dubai, Ranya's earlier bail pleas were rejected.

title: 10-year-old girl returning home from school sexually assaulted in Tamil Nadu
content: A shocking incident occurred near Gummidipoondi. A 10-year-old girl was abducted and sexually assaulted. The girl was returning home from school. An unidentified man committed this heinous crime. The girl bravely raised an alarm. This forced the perpetrator to flee. Police have registered a case under the Pocso Act. Special teams are searching for the suspect.

title: Aadhaar advisory: UIDAI to parent; Your child’s AADHAAR may be deactivated if …
content: The Unique Identification Authority of India has issued an advisory. Parents must update biometrics for children aged seven. Failure to comply may lead to Aadhaar deactivation. UIDAI emphasizes the importance of accurate biometric data. They are sending SMS reminders to registered mobile numbers. Updates are free before age seven, then a fee applies. Timely action ensures continued Aadhaar validity.

title: 'Not afraid of war': Syria slams Israel's 'wide-scale targeting' of civilians - Key details
content: Syria's interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa pledged accountability for those who harmed the Druze population, following Israeli airstrikes in Damascus targeting military and government sites. He reassured Druze citizens, rejecting external interference and transferring security responsibilities to local leaders. Al-Sharaa affirmed the Syrian people's readiness to defend their dignity, prioritizing national interests over conflict.

title: Travel diary: Manchester's 'other' Old Trafford getting ready for fourth India vs England Test
content: In Manchester, navigating to Old Trafford reveals a charming mix-up between the cricket and football stadiums. Locals, signage, and even security guards often point to the football ground first. But with the India-England Test set to take place on July 23, attention will soon shift to the "other" Old Trafford as preparations ramp up for its biggest game of the season.

title: Chinese restaurant under fire for offering lion cub cuddles
content: A Chinese restaurant is facing severe criticism for offering customers the chance to cuddle lion cubs during afternoon tea. Animal welfare groups are condemning the practice as exploitative and potentially dangerous, highlighting ethical concerns and the risk of injury. Despite the backlash, the restaurant defends its actions, claiming the cubs are well-cared for.

title: AI race heats up: Donald Trump says: ‘We’re way ahead of China'
content: President Trump unveiled $92 billion in energy and infrastructure deals to support Big Tech's AI electricity demands, emphasizing the need to surpass China in AI development. Google pledged $25 billion for AI-ready data centers and hydropower modernization, while Blackstone committed over $25 billion to data centers and energy infrastructure.

title: Trade war: Trump plans 10–15% tariffs for over 150 countries; deal with India 'very close'
content: Donald Trump announced that the U.S. is nearing a trade agreement with India and seeing positive progress with the EU, while a deal with Canada remains uncertain. He also floated the idea of imposing tariffs on smaller nations. These discussions occur as the U.S. seeks improved trade terms before an August 1 deadline for tariff increases on most U.S. imports.

title: Snake rescuer dies after flaunting cobra on neck for 'reel'
content: Deepak Mahawar, a 42-year-old snake rescuer in Madhya Pradesh, tragically died after a cobra he rescued bit him. He had been posing with the snake around his neck for a social media video near his son's school. Although initially treated and showing signs of recovery, his condition worsened, leading to his death within 12 hours of the bite.

title: Astronomers capture birth of planets around a baby sun
content: Astronomers have spotted the earliest stages of rocky planet formation around a young, sun-like star named HOPS-315. Using the Webb Space Telescope and ESO's Alma telescope, scientists detected solid specks condensing within the gas disk, revealing silicon monoxide gas and crystalline silicate minerals. This unprecedented glimpse into "time zero" suggests planet formation could be a common process.

title: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk on Tesla India launch: Meet you at ...
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens on a flat note; BSE Sensex near 82,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, started Thursday’s trading session on a flat note. While Nifty50 was near 25,200, BSE Sensex was around 82,600.

title: 2025 ESPY Awards: 5 Best-dressed stars who dominated the red carpet
content: The 2025 ESPY Awards in Los Angeles saw athletes shine both in accomplishment and style. Suni Lee's gold gown set the tone, while Lindsey Vonn and Ilona Maher impressed with daring looks. Simone Biles and Jonathan Owens coordinated in stunning fashion, and Jordan Chiles brought elegance in a woven gown.

title: 'Won't keep a rupee': Co-star on Radhika Yadav music video; denies ‘fame chase’ claims
content: Inam-ul-Haq, Radhika Yadav's co-star in 'Karwaan', pledges to donate all earnings from the music video. This decision follows the tragic death of Radhika, who was allegedly killed by her father. Inam denies any personal relationship with Radhika. He also rejects any communal angle to the incident. He is ready to cooperate with the police investigation.

title: Ahead of Bihar polls Nitish announces key scheme: Free electricity upto 125 units
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has announced free electricity for domestic consumers, up to 125 units, starting August 1, 2025. Kumar highlighted his government's focus on affordability, stating that this initiative will benefit approximately 1 crore 67 lakh families across the state. This announcement comes as the state gears up for elections in late 2025.

title: Explained: Federal Prosecutor Comey fired - was it for 'botching' Epstein-Maxwell & Diddy cases?
content: Maurene Comey, known for her involvement in the Ghislaine Maxwell and Sean "Diddy" Combs cases, was fired by the Trump administration, raising concerns about political interference. The dismissal follows other departures at SDNY and renewed scrutiny of Epstein files. Critics suggest her family connection to James Comey and the Combs trial outcome contributed to her removal, potentially impacting prosecutorial independence.

title: Narco nexus: Indo-Canadian drug lord held in US; ISI-China-Khalistan links found
content: The US Drug Enforcement Agency dismantled an international drug cartel with ties to the ISI, China, and Canada, arresting Opinder Singh Sian, also known as Thanos. Sian operated a global fentanyl and methamphetamine trafficking ring from British Columbia.

title: Shaquille O’Neal threatens to punch Robert Griffin III over Angel Reese
content: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal has issued a stern warning to former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III over his negative comments and a racist social media post targeting WNBA player Angel Reese. O'Neal, angered by Griffin's actions, particularly the reposting of a derogatory image, threatened physical violence if Griffin continues his behavior.

title: Actress Ranya Rao gets 1-year jail term: No bail allowed under COFEPOSA
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao, embroiled in a gold smuggling case, faces a year of imprisonment under COFEPOSA after being arrested at Bengaluru airport with 14.8 kg of gold. Despite initially receiving default bail due to DRI procedural lapses, she remains detained. Investigations revealed multiple Dubai trips and significant seizures of gold and cash from her residence, leading to charges under the Customs Act.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today; check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha from Nuvama Professional Clients Group suggests Hero Motocorp and Tata Power as top buys, citing bullish patterns and breakouts. He recommends selling Solar Industries India, anticipating profit-taking after a significant rally, targeting a correction to the 13700-800 range.

title: UP: 14-year-old girl dies by suicide days after being raped by three minors
content: A 14-year-old girl in Bulandshahr's Khurja area tragically died by suicide after being gang-raped by three minors. The assault occurred on June 28, leading to an FIR being filed under relevant laws. Overwhelmed by trauma and mental stress following the incident, the girl was found dead at her home, prompting a police investigation.

title: Massive quake: 7.3 tremor strikes off Alaska coast; tsunami warning issued
content: A significant 7.3 magnitude earthquake struck the coast of Alaska on Wednesday, triggering a tsunami warning across a large portion of the Alaska Peninsula and extending towards Anchorage. The earthquake, centered off Sand Point on Popof Island, prompted the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to issue the warning due to the potential for serious damage.

title: ‘My daughter was born here, she’s Indian’: Russian woman’s ex adds to cave family saga
content: Following Nina Kutina's arrest for living in a cave near Gokarna with their two daughters, her ex-husband, Dror Goldstein, is seeking shared custody. Goldstein, who lives part-time in Goa, states he lost contact with Kutina and the children months ago. He expresses concern about their potential relocation to Russia and desires regular access to his daughters in India.

title: Watch: Massive fire engulfs Tomorrowland main stage in Belgium
content: A devastating fire has severely damaged the main stage of the Tomorrowland festival in Belgium, just days before its scheduled opening. While no injuries were reported among the 1,000 staff members present, the iconic stage is almost completely destroyed. Despite the setback, organizers have confirmed that the festival will proceed, with DreamVille opening as planned.

title: Kerala woman, toddler found hanging in UAE; suicide note posted on Facebook
content: Kundara Police filed cases against Nitheesh, Neethu, and Mohanan. They are accused of abetting the suicide of Vipanchika and her daughter in Sharjah. Vipanchika's family alleges dowry harassment and abuse. A suicide note detailing the torture surfaced online. The family demands repatriation of the bodies and a thorough postmortem.

title: 2 Instagram influencers held in UP for vulgar content
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district, police have arrested four individuals—Mehak, Pari, Hina, and Jarrar Alam—for allegedly creating and posting obscene content on Instagram. The group reportedly used vulgar language and explicit visuals to attract viewers and generate income, earning approximately Rs 25,000 to Rs 30,000 monthly.

title: Rahul, Kharge write to PM Modi for J&K statehood; CM Omar Abdullah welcomes move
content: Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge have urged Prime Minister Modi to restore statehood to Jammu & Kashmir via a parliamentary bill during the monsoon session. They also advocated for Sixth Schedule constitutional safeguards for Ladakh, addressing cultural, developmental, and political needs while protecting rights and identity.

title: Bengali-speaker raids: Calcutta HC steps in; demands Centre’s clarification
content: Calcutta High Court has directed the Union government to clarify the rationale behind the nationwide raids targeting Bengali-speaking individuals, suspecting them as illegal Bangladeshi migrants. The court raised concerns about potential wrongful acts and illegal deportations based solely on language.

title: 'Would call her Ma': Shubhangi Atre recalls how Rupali Ganguly cared for her daughter
content: Shubhangi Atre, known for her role in Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain, recently shared her early experiences in the television industry, highlighting the challenges of being a working mother. She fondly remembers her Kasturi co-star, Rupali Ganguly, who played a significant role in caring for her daughter, Ashi, on set.

title: Can’t win today's warfare with yesterday’s weapons, desi drone tech must: CDS Chauhan
content: General Anil Chauhan emphasized the critical need for India to develop indigenous drone and counter-UAS technologies to maintain a strategic advantage. He highlighted Operation Sindoor, where Pakistan's drones caused no damage, underscoring the limitations of relying on foreign systems.

title: Balasore girl killed self after being forced to apologise to harasser, drop plaint - Kin
content: A college student in Odisha died after allegedly being coerced by her principal to withdraw a sexual harassment complaint. Prior to setting herself ablaze, she was allegedly pressured to apologize to the accused faculty member. The incident sparked public outrage, leading to protests and political clashes.

title: Aadhaar cleanup: UIDAI disables 1.2 crore dead IDs; 100+ age cases under scan
content: To prevent misuse, the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has deactivated approximately 1.2 crore Aadhaar numbers of deceased individuals, utilizing death records from 24 states and Union Territories. A new service on the myAadhaar portal allows family members to report a death.

title: Talks on with RJD & Left, but Congress may settle for 50-60 seats in Bihar
content: Congress is likely to contest fewer seats in Bihar than in 2020, aiming for 50-60 seats while prioritizing winnability after a disappointing performance last time. The party seeks alliance coherence and aims to strengthen the anti-NDA coalition by promoting Rahul Gandhi's message among backward classes. This strategic shift reflects lessons learned from past failures and a focus on unity.

title: Renewable energy push sees NTPC get nod to invest Rs 20,000 crore in green arms
content: The Cabinet has approved significant green energy investments, raising NTPC's limit to Rs 20,000 crore and allowing NLC India to invest Rs 7,000 crore. These decisions aim to boost renewable energy capacity, with NTPC targeting 60GW by 2032. India has already achieved 50% non-fossil fuel electricity capacity, advancing its goals for 500GW by 2030 and net-zero emissions by 2070.

title: You too committed offence by having sex outside marriage, Supreme Court tells woman
content: The Supreme Court questioned a married woman who sought the cancellation of anticipatory bail for a man accused of rape on the false promise of marriage. The court suggested she might face prosecution for engaging in extramarital affairs, highlighting her awareness of the relationship's implications. The Patna High Court's decision to grant anticipatory bail to the accused was upheld.

title: Magic Johnson: Ends luxury getaway; Cookie Johnson joins him
content: Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, recently concluded their European vacation, sharing joyful moments with family and friends on Instagram. The trip included stops in Monaco, Croatia, Portofino, and Cannes, filled with fine dining, attending plays, and yacht retreats. Magic emphasized family time, posting a group photo with his children and grandchildren, highlighting his role as a dedicated family man.

title: Conor McGregor breaks silence: Cryptic tweet after Azealia Banks leak
content: Azealia Banks ignited a social media storm by claiming Conor McGregor, celebrating his birthday in Italy, sent her nude photos. Instead of directly addressing the allegations, McGregor responded to a fan's joke with a political comment about Irish politics. Banks further alleged a long history of nude exchanges and harassment, while McGregor continued posting from his yacht, seemingly unfazed.

title: Parliamentary panel on I-T Bill backs time-bound resolution of tax cases
content: A parliamentary panel has suggested time-bound resolution of tax litigations as part of its 285 recommendations on the Income Tax Bill, 2025. The bill, aimed at simplifying and modernizing tax laws, has been examined by a Lok Sabha select committee.

title: Kin of murdered Yemeni refuse pardon for Nimisha Priya
content: The family of the Yemeni man murdered by Nimisha Priya, an Indian nurse sentenced to death, has firmly rejected any possibility of pardon or blood money. Despite efforts by Indian authorities and religious leaders to negotiate, the victim's brother insists on retribution.

title: Supreme Court reverses custody order after child has a mental breakdown
content: The Supreme Court recalled its order granting custody of a 12-year-old boy to his divorced father after realizing the decision caused severe mental and emotional distress to the child. The court acknowledged its error, along with the Kerala High Court, in prioritizing the father's claim without considering the child's well-being and attachment to his mother, ultimately reversing the custody order.

title: Election Commission's Bihar drive doesn't find 35.7 lakh voters at their addresses
content: The Election Commission (EC) is set to share details of approximately 3.57 million Bihar electors, constituting 4.5% of the state's electorate, who were not found at their registered addresses during mandatory visits. This information will be provided to political parties' district presidents and booth level agents for verification by July 25.

title: Supreme Court acquits man facing gallows; criticises prosecution, courts
content: The Supreme Court acquitted a man after 11 years of imprisonment, overturning his death sentence for the alleged murder of six family members in Phagwara, 2014. The court cited a lack of credible evidence, criticizing the trial court and High Court for relying on unreliable eyewitness accounts riddled with inconsistencies.

title: Drains along M.G. Road in Kochi to be renovated to increase carrying capacity
content: Of the 9.40-km stretch, 2.60 km from Pharmacy Junction likely to be covered in initial phase; PWD to use ₹10 cr. under Operation Breakthrough

title: Schools in Kozhikode step up security with strengthened SPG network
content: The SPGs, functioning under the heads of institutions, mainly comprise student representatives, parent-teacher association nominees, and community members from diverse sectors who can closely monitor student movements

title: Air India finds no issues with locking mechanism of fuel control switch in B787 planes: Official
content: The official also said that all the Boeing 787-8 aircraft have undergone Throttle Control Module (TCM) replacement as per the Boeing maintenance schedule

title: Fencing out the voter in Bihar’s poll roll preparation
content: The Supreme Court must intervene, once again, in the matter of the Bihar Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls and ensure that the manner of the preparation meets India’s exacting constitutional standards

title: Suvendu demands ‘thorough revision’ of voter list in Bengal
content: West Bengal goes to the polls next year, while the Assembly election is due in Bihar later this year.

title: Govt will train CSCs in AI, address duplication in State govt efforts: Vaishnaw
content: The IT Minister felicitated CSC operators in remote and rural districts, and said the government would train CSC workers in AI and address issues arising from duplication of CSC work by State government initiatives.

title: Share of clean energy in India’s electricity less than 30% despite 50% of installed capacity
content: Despite the rise in clean energy, the slower rise utilisation is due to its lower ‘capacity utilisation factor’; flexibility in the grid and improved battery storage are the way forward, says expert

title: Flash floods: 16 families relocated at Maruthonkara in Kozhikode
content: Recue squads on alert in landslip-prone areas on the orders of the District Disaster Management Authority

title: AI will boost decision-making and operational precision, says Lt. General Manjinder Singh
content: The General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, South Western Command stressed the importance of developing sophisticated capabilities to counter hybrid threats that blur the lines between peace and war

title: 357 Maoists killed across country in a year, says Bastar IG
content: Mr. Sundarraj said the admission highlighted the severe setbacks suffered by the banned outfit, especially in core conflict zones

title: Ties in region back in focus with PM’s visit to Maldives
content: PM Modi to attend Independence Day celebrations in Male on July 26; plans are also under way for a proposed visit to Delhi by Nepal PM Oli, which will be the first since he was took charge in 2024

title: 34 of 100 large glacial lakes show an ‘increasing trend’ in water spread area, Central Water Commission tells NGT
content: The National Green Tribunal is looking into the issue of melting glaciers resulting in an increase in the size of glacier lakes, and the danger of their overflowing and bursting, with consequential effects

title: Parliamentary panel clears Income Tax Bill 2025 with 285 suggestions, to be tabled in Monsoon Session
content: Introduced in Lok Sabha on February 13, 2025, the Bill was referred to a Select Committee on the same day with instructions to report by the first day of Monsoon Session

title: PM Modi to unveil projects worth over ₹7,000 crore in Bihar on July 18
content: The Prime Minister should speak about basic issues like unemployment, and migration, confronting the state. Of late the law-and-order situation in the State has become alarming, and the PM must say something on this as well

title: Parliament canteen rolls out curated ‘health menu’
content: The wellness initiative has been taken up by Lok Sabha Speak Om Birla; the dishes on offer are millet-based meals, fibre-rich salads and protein-packed soups as part of a broader effort to support a healthy diet

title: Himachal Pradesh to get additional ₹150 crore revenue after royalty hike in hydroelectric project
content: A State government statement said the JSW energy company will have to pay 18% royalty to the State instead of 12% from the Karcham-Wangtoo hydroelectric project

title: NMC rejects Karnataka’s proposal to start three new medical colleges, enhancement of government college medical seats
content: NMC cites a lack of necessary infrastructure and faculty recruitment as it denies permission for two govt. medical colleges for the third time

title: Renewed optimism in Canada-India economic ties, says business council leader
content: India presents enormous potential for Canadian firms looking to diversify beyond the U.S. market, says Victor T. Thomas, president and CEO of the Canada-India Business Council

title: Social activist alleges negligence in Rahul Gandhi’s security during U.P. court visit, seeks probe
content: Amitabh Thakur, a former IPS officer and social activist, alleges that security personnel allowed hundreds of people into a Lucknow courtroom during a Congress leader’s appearance

title: BBMP to float tender for stray dog microchipping project, for third time
content: Project is estimated to cost ₹3.23 crore of which ₹3.09 crore is allocated for procuring 1,62,817 microchips and ₹14.85 lakh is set aside for purchasing 50 microchip readers

title: Incessant rain slows down life in Ernakulam
content: City spared major waterlogging due to relatively low-intensity rain; runoff water caused minor issues on some roads in Edakochi, says councillor

title: Veteran Congress leader C.V. Padmarajan passes away
content: He had handled Finance, Power, and Fisheries in the K. Karunakaran and A.K. Antony governments. He was twice elected to the Assembly from the Chathanoor constituency in Kollam district. He also served as the president of the Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee from 1983 to 1987

title: Government merges 36 schemes to float farm programme
content: The PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana, announced in the Budget earlier this year, aims at increasing agricultural productivity and sustainable practices with an annual outlay of ₹24,000 crore for six years

title: Biles, SGA, Eagles capture top honors at ESPYS
content: Olympic champion gymnast Simone Biles and NBA Finals MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander took home top athlete honors, while the Super Bowl champ Eagles won best team at Wednesday night's ESPYS.

title: Source: Vet Miller to Commanders on 1-year deal
content: The Commanders are signing veteran defensive end Von Miller, a move designed to bolster their pass rush and increase their ability to close out games on defense.

title: Agent: Beal OK's buyout with Suns, to join Clips
content: Bradley Beal has agreed to a buyout with the Suns and plans to join the Clippers on a two-year, $11M deal with an option after he clears waivers, his agent told ESPN.

title: Miami 'outclassed' as historic Messi streak ends
content: Lionel Messi's MLS record streak of scoring two goals in a game ended at five as Inter Miami CF lost 3-0 to FC Cincinnati on Wednesday night.

title: Clark out vs. Liberty; All-Star status uncertain
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who injured her right groin late in Tuesday's win over the Sun, was ruled out for Wednesday's game against the Liberty.

title: 5-star Boozer: Duke 'overlooked,' but not for long
content: Five-star prospect and incoming Duke freshman Cameron Boozer told ESPN on Wednesday the Blue Devils have been "overlooked" this offseason following the departures of Cooper Flagg and other NBA talent.

title: Chargers' Harris (eye) likely to start camp on NFI
content: Chargers running back Najee Harris, who has an eye injury, will likely begin training camp on the NFI list, general manager Joe Hortiz said Wednesday.

title: Mizrachi wins first WSOP main event, $10M prize
content: Michael "The Grinder" Mizrachi took home the $10 million first prize by eliminating John Wasnock in heads-up poker to win the World Series of Poker main event Wednesday.

title: 🏈 Barnwell: Ranking best NFL teams since 2000
content: With 25 NFL seasons in the books since 2000, let's pick the 25 best teams. How many Patriots, Eagles and Chiefs squads make the list?

title: What to expect from Rory and Scottie, and how will Royal Portrush play?
content: Is Scottie Scheffler the overwhelming favorite? Is Rory McIlroy's game rounding into form? We look at five storylines to watch this week at the Open Championship.

title: B- for the Fever? A- for Valkyries? Grading every WNBA team at midseason
content: The Valkyries join the Lynx and Mercury near the front of the class, while the Fever and Sky have improved marks.

title: Who are the NFL's best wide receivers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: The clear two-man race features two stars who grew up about 10 miles apart, played at LSU together and are trading blows for the No. 1 ranking each year.

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps
content: What are the most important positional battles and injuries to monitor at NFL training camps? Ben Solak gives his picks.

title: Passan: Inside the first swing-off in MLB All-Star Game history
content: On a night full of firsts, none resonated as much as the finale -- and Kyle Schwarber's titanic performance.

title: From New Jersey to Madrid via Brazil, Atlético is next big step for USMNT's Johnny Cardoso
content: Johnny Cardoso had a difficult summer with the U.S., but joining Atlético Madrid is a chance to step up and meet a new challenge. He's used to that.

title: 2025 MLB draft recap: Best picks, biggest steals and analysis for all 30 teams
content: Now that all 20 rounds are complete, it's time to see what Kiley McDaniel makes of your team's draft haul.

title: Betting: Top storylines for the season's second half
content: There is increasing interest in the AL MVP race as well as an emerging NL Rookie of the Year contender.

title: Why a 46-year-old Pacquiao is boxing again
content: Manny Pacquiao is back to a familiar place in Los Angeles, looking for a new start and to add to his legendary career.

title: Building Duke's all-time roster: Does Cooper Flagg make the cut?
content: Some names were obvious (Hill, Laettner). Others sparked a debate (Flagg, Williamson). But we think we got the all-time roster right.

title: 'I'm like, I know it's you': Arch Manning, Lane Kiffin headline top SEC media day quotes
content: Conference media days are always ripe with quality quotes, and the witticisms from Atlanta did not disappoint.

title: Girelli shows Norway how to be clinical as Italy reach Euro 2025 semifinal
content: Italy are in their first Euro semifinal since 1997 as Cristiana Girelli netted a brace and Norway's Ada Hegerberg struggled.

title: Revitalized Sweden pose serious threat to England
content: Three years ago when the teams met, the score was one-sided. This Swedish team is a different proposition, though.

title: Yamal given Messi's iconic Barça No. 10 jersey
content: Lamine Yamal has been handed the iconic Barcelona No. 10 shirt previously worn by Lionel Messi, the Catalan club confirmed Wednesday.

title: Nico Williams explains 10-year Athletic extension
content: Nico Williams said he wants to continue making history at Athletic Club having turned down offers to leave the Basque outfit this summer.

title: Poland hire new coach after Lewandowski fallout
content: Jan Urban has been appointed as Poland national manager, the country's football association (PZPN) said on Wednesday, with the 63-year-old replacing Michal Probierz who resigned in June.

title: Angel City's King eyes full recovery after collapse
content: Angel City FC defender Savy King credited the team's medical staff for saving her life in May when she collapsed on the field during an NWSL game in May.

title: 'Great club legend' Vázquez's time in Madrid over
content: Lucas Vázquez, an important player for Real Madrid during one of its most successful eras, is ending his stint with the Spanish powerhouse.

title: Freese 'devastated' but hungry after Mexico loss
content: USMNT goalkeeper Matt Freese said he felt devastated following the Gold Cup final loss to Mexico, but insists it will be motivation for the World Cup.

title: USMNT's Johnny Cardoso joins Atlético Madrid
content: United States national team midfielder Johnny Cardoso has completed his transfer to Atlético Madrid from Real Betis.

title: Alexander-Arnold transformed Liverpool. Will he do the same for Real Madrid?
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold left the Premier League as one of its best players ever. Whether he can reach similar heights in LaLiga as a Real Madrid player will be fascinating to watch.

title: Ward, McMillan and others primed to follow path of 2024 breakouts
content: These players are in position to follow a similar path to last year's breakouts and produce big numbers.

title: Year 2 player spotlight: Maye, Harrison, Odunze among popular breakouts
content: The ESPN Fantasy staff lists NFL sophomores who are undervalued in drafts and others who are under scrutiny.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the MLB season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Behind the scenes with a heavyweight champion
content: ESPN goes behind the scenes in camp with Oleksandr Usyk ahead of his undisputed heavyweight title fight against Daniel Dubois on July 19.

title: US Embassy's Visa Warning After Indian Caught Stealing From Target Store
content: An Indian woman allegedly spent over seven hours in a Target store, picking up items worth Rs 1.1 lakh and then tried to leave the store without paying.

title: "RCB invited public without consulting police": Karnataka government's status report on Bengaluru stampede
content: "RCB invited public without consulting police": Karnataka government's status report on Bengaluru stampede

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Anguish Of Nimisha Priya And The Imperative Of Compassion
content: Nimisha's story is, sadly, one that epitomises the hopes and vulnerabilities of many Keralites who seek opportunity in distant lands.

title: Odisha Bandh Today, Roads Empty In Protest Over Student's Self-Immolation
content: The 20-year-old student of Fakir Mohan Autonomous College in Balasore attempted self-immolation last week after allegedly facing prolonged sexual harassment by her college's Head of Department.

title: Assets Worth Rs 9.56 Crore Returned To Official Liquidator In Bank Fraud Case
content: In a major breakthrough in its anti-money laundering efforts, the Enforcement Directorate, Kolkata Zonal Office, has successfully restituted immovable and movable properties worth Rs 9.56 crore to the Official Liquidator of Kaushik Glob

title: KTR Sidelines Sister Kavitha For Key Appointment Amid Reports Of Rift
content: The Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) working president KT Rama Rao has appointed former minister Koppula Eashwar as the party's in-charge for the Telangana Boggu Gani Karmika Sangham (TBGKS), the influential coal miners' union.

title: 4 Dead As Bangladeshi Forces Clash With Sheikh Hasina Supporters
content: Bangladeshi security forces on Wednesday clashed with supporters of ousted Sheikh Hasina, leaving at least four people dead and scores injured, a hospital official and local media said.

title: Syria, Druze Leaders Announce New Ceasefire As Israel Continues Strikes
content: Convoys of government forces began withdrawing from the city of Sweida, but it was not immediately clear if the agreement, announced by Syria's Interior Ministry and in a video message by a Druze religious leader, would hold.

title: Syria Says Withdrawing Troops After Agreeing To Ceasefire In Sweida
content: Syria announced it had begun withdrawing its army from Druze-majority Sweida city on Wednesday night after agreeing to a new ceasefire that it said would bring a complete halt to its military operations there.

title: Trump Says US "Very Close To Deal With India" As Tariff Deadline Looms
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday hinted at reaching a new trade deal with India soon. While adding "maybe", he said that currently the US is in negotiations with India.

title: US Court Says Would Block Trump's Birthright Citizenship Order Nationwide
content: A federal judge in Maryland could soon become the second to block President order restricting from taking effect nationwide, if an appeals court were to allow it.

title: "It's Just Better": Trump Says Coca-Cola To Switch To Cane Sugar In US
content: Beverage giant Coca-Cola has agreed to use real cane sugar in its US production, President Donald Trump announced Wednesday on social media.

title: Maurene Comey, Prosecutor In Sean 'Diddy' Combs, Epstein Cases, Fired From Job
content: Maurene Comey was a veteran lawyer in the Southern District of New York, long considered the most elite of the Justice Department's prosecution offices.

title: Trump Believes China Will Sentence Fentanyl Traffickers To Death
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said that the US will work out a deal with China where the latter would give the death penalty to those who transport fentanyl drug into the US.

title: 'Will Die By Suicide': Brother Of Odisha Woman Flags Trolling, Goes To Cops
content: The elder brother of the 20-year-old woman student in Odisha, who died after she set herself on fire in protest against sexual harassment by a professor, has filed a police complaint seeking protection for the family from cyber harassment.

title: 7.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits US' Alaska, Tsunami Warning Issued
content: A 7.3-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the US state of Alaska on Wednesday, triggering a tsunami warning, the US Geological Survey said.

title: Marco Rubio Says Steps Agreed To End Syria Fighting
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said there was an agreement to restore calm in Syria by late Wednesday, as he blamed misunderstandings over violence that included Israeli strikes on its neighbor's capital.

title: International Court Rejects Israel's Request To Withdraw Netanyahu's Arrest Warrant
content: Judges at the International Criminal Court rejected Israel's request to withdraw arrest warrants against its prime minister and former defence minister while the ICC reviews Israeli challenges to its jurisdiction over the conduct of the Gaza war.

title: US Aviation Body Not Considering Contracts With Musk's SpaceX Starlink
content: The Federal Aviation Administration told lawmakers it is not considering replacing its current telecommunication contracts it holds with L3Harris or Verizon Communications with Elon Musk's SpaceX's Starlink satellite unit.

content: if the latest era of Phoenix Suns basketball mostly ended last month, it reached its full conclusion . the franchise bought out the remainder of Bradley Beal 's contract, just two seasons after acquiring him . he quickly engineered blockbuster trades for Durant and Beal, who had a combined 16 All-Star appearances .

title: FIFA reveals details to apply for World Cup tickets
content:
Applications for tickets for the 2026 World Cup open Sept. 10, FIFA said Tuesday. The next edition of the tournament, which will be co-hosted by Canada, Mexico and the United States, kicks off at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City on June 11. Soccer's world governing body FIFA said that due to anticipated high demand tickets would be released in phases. -  World Cup lessons from Club World Cup 
-  Club World Cup takeaways 
-  Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC It did not say if it would use dynamic pricing, as was the case for the Club World Cup, which saw ticket prices fluctuate wildly. "We're looking forward to welcoming the world back to North America, as Canada, Mexico and the United States host what will be the biggest and greatest sporting event ever," FIFA president Gianni Infantino said in a statement. "We encourage fans everywhere to get ready to secure their place -- these will be the most coveted seats in world sport."
